item.title: Berkeley Balcony Collapse Kills 5, Including Irish Tourists
item.description: Eight other people were injured in the accident near the University of California, some sustaining life-threatening wounds, the police said.
item.dc:creator: QUENTIN HARDY and MITCH SMITH
item.media:description: The collapsed balcony where five people died at an apartment complex in Berkeley, Calif., early Tuesday.

item.title: Tunisian Train Hits Truck Blocking Tracks, 18 Dead
item.description: A Tunisian passenger train smashed into a semi-trailer truck racing to cross the tracks early Tuesday morning, killing 18 people as two carriages derailed.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Failure of Obama’s Trade Deal Could Hurt U.S. Influence in Asia
item.description: The death of the Trans-Pacific Partnership would be a new setback for American economic diplomacy in the region after a failed attempt to thwart a Chinese state-run infrastructure investment fund.
item.category: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN SOBLE
item.media:description: A tea farm in Shizuoka, Japan. The defeat of a Trans-Pacific Partnership would most likely set back Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's efforts to open up the Japanese agricultural sector and other protected industries.

item.title: Tracing a 17-Year-Old’s Path From Britain to an ISIS Suicide Attack
item.description: Talha Asmal, a student from West Yorkshire, would be his country’s youngest known suicide bomber if his role in an attack in Iraq is confirmed.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: KATRIN BENNHOLD
item.media:description: Talha Asmal, a British teenager who apparently detonated a car full of explosives at Iraq’s largest oil refinery, in an image posted on a militant website.

item.title: Ligny Journal: 200 Years After Waterloo, Napoleon Still Wins by Losing
item.description: As Europe observes the Waterloo bicentennial, the legend of the defeated emperor continues to draw crowds while Wellington, the victor, is forgotten.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW HIGGINS

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: What You Need to Know About the Vote on Hong Kong’s Election Rules
item.description: Hong Kong lawmakers are to begin debating on Wednesday a Beijing-backed proposal to change how the city selects its top official. We offer a primer on the issues.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Pro-democracy demonstrators outside the Legislative Council in Hong Kong on Monday night.

item.title: Janine Gibson, a Former Guardian Editor, Will Head BuzzFeed’s British Operation
item.description: Ms. Gibson, who left The Guardian after being passed over for the editor in chief post, will oversee an expansion of BuzzFeed news staff in Britain.
item.dc:creator: RAVI SOMAIYA
item.media:credit: Paul Morigi/Getty Images for The Guardian

item.title: China to Halt Its Building of Islands, but Not Its Projects on Them
item.description: The announcement may have been intended to ease tensions with the United States, which has strongly criticized the construction of the outcroppings.
item.dc:creator: EDWARD WONG
item.media:credit: Center for Strategic and International Studies, via Digital Globe
item.media:description: A satellite image from March 16 shows work on an emerging artificial island at Mischief Reef, part of the Spratly Islands, in the South China Sea.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Q. and A.: Holden Chow on China, Elections and Hong Kong’s Attitude
item.description: Mr. Chow, of the pro-Beijing Democratic Alliance for the Betterment and Progress of Hong Kong, said it would be a mistake to vote against a proposal to allow all those eligible to cast a ballot in the 2017 election for the city’s top leader.
item.category: Democratic Alliance for the Betterment and Progress of Hong Kong
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL FORSYTHE
item.media:description: Holden Chow, vice chairman of the Democratic Alliance for the Betterment and Progress of Hong Kong.

item.title: Hong Kong Election Plan Appears Unlikely to Win Lawmakers’ Approval
item.description: Both opponents and supporters of a Beijing-backed proposal for picking the city’s top official said it lacked the necessary votes on the Legislative Council.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL FORSYTHE and ALAN WONG
item.media:description: Police officers outside the Legislative Council in Hong Kong on Tuesday. Lawmakers are set to reject a plan vetted in Beijing that would change the way this former British colony selects its top official.

item.title: Kurds Capture Key Islamic State-Held Border Town in Syria
item.description: Kurdish fighters took full control of the border town of Tal Abyad on Tuesday, dealing a major blow to the Islamic State group's ability to wage war in Syria by cutting off a vital supply line to its self-proclaimed capital of Raqqa.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Bahrain Shiite Opposition Leader Sentenced to 4 Years
item.description: A Bahraini court sentenced the country's leading Shiite opposition figure to four years in prison on Tuesday amid an ongoing crackdown on dissent in the tiny island kingdom.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Al Qaeda Confirms U.S. Strike Killed Nasser al-Wuhayshi, Its Leader in Yemen
item.description: Nasser al-Wuhayshi, 38, had led the group’s operations in the country since 2002 and was also the second-ranking leader of the global extremist network.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
item.dc:creator: KAREEM FAHIM
item.media:description: The second-ranking official of Al Qaeda, Nasser al-Wuhayshi, in Yemen in 2012.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Nepal Quake Moved Everest About One Inch, Study Finds
item.description: Chinese researchers say the earthquake on April 25 was so strong that it moved the world’s highest peak southwest.
item.dc:creator: PATRICK BOEHLER
item.media:description: Mount Everest moved 15.7 inches in the decade preceding the April 25 earthquake in Nepal, according to a survey.

item.title: Philippine Rebels Give Up Dozens of Weapons in Step Toward Peace Deal
item.description: The largely symbolic surrender of 75 weapons was seen as an important gesture, but full disarmament must await final approval of the pact by Congress.
item.dc:creator: FLOYD WHALEY
item.media:description: Al Haj Murad Ebrahim, the head of the Moro Islamic Liberation Front, inspecting a rocket launcher at the handover in Sultan Kudarat, Philippines, on Tuesday. President Benigno S. Aquino III, far left, said: “Our brothers are voluntarily laying down their arms.”

item.title: Offering Services, ISIS Digs In Deeper in Seized Territories
item.description: The jihadists’ governing efforts, from inspecting food to offering perks to newlyweds, have brought a stability unavailable from national governments.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: BEN HUBBARD
item.media:description: Deir al-Zour, Syria, in 2014. Since taking control of the area, the Islamic State has been attacked and has not granted some of the liberties that it permits elsewhere.

item.title: Where Racewalking Is King, the Antidoping Officials Are Busy
item.description: Viktor Chegin has attained national hero status in Russia, but now he and his training center are at the center of one of track’s biggest scandals.
item.dc:creator: CHARLY WILDER

item.title: Q. & A.: Prime Minister Modi’s Yoga Consultant, H.R. Nagendra
item.description: Dr. Nagendra, a yoga therapist in Bangalore, has been consulting with Narendra Modi, now India’s prime minister, since the 1980s.
item.dc:creator: ELLEN BARRY

item.title: Open Source: Israeli Government Cartoon Mocks Foreign Coverage of Gaza
item.description: The video is part of Israel’s intensifying effort to undermine potential criticism from the United Nations of its military assault on Gaza last summer.
item.dc:creator: ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: No. 2 Qaeda Leader May Have Died in U.S. Airstrike in Yemen
item.description: Yemeni officials and extremists said Nasser al Wuhayshi, the leader of Al Qaeda’s Yemen affiliate, was killed last week; American officials said they could not confirm the reports.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: SCOTT SHANE
